title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MILWAUKEE — In a performance that will be etched into the annals of franchise history, Glenn Robinson delivered a breathtaking offensive masterclass, single-handedly dismantling the New Jersey Nets and powering the Milwaukee Bucks to a 101-91 victory.

On this night, "Big Dog" wasn't just on the hunt; he was a force of nature. Robinson poured in a colossal 42 points, a scoring barrage so potent it rendered all other game narratives secondary. He was unstoppable from every angle, shooting a scalding 17-for-27 from the field while also contributing 7 rebounds. The Nets rotated defenders, but no one had an answer for his polished, relentless attack on the rim.

While Robinson was the undeniable star, he received timely support. Ray Allen chipped in 21 points, providing a necessary secondary scoring punch, while Tyrone Hill dominated the glass with 17 rebounds, controlling the paint and creating extra opportunities for Milwaukee’s scorers.

The Nets, despite a valiant 23-point effort from Kendall Gill and a near triple-double of 12 points, 14 rebounds, and 8 assists from Sam Cassell, simply had no counter for Robinson’s historic output. Every time New Jersey threatened to close the gap, Robinson would respond with another clutch basket, silencing the run and steadying his team.

In the end, the story was simple and singular: Glenn Robinson. His 42-point explosion was more than just a win; it was a statement performance, a legendary night where one player’s will and talent completely dominated the hardwood and secured a crucial victory for the Bucks.
